sentences.sentence: What a time it seemed!
Comparing notes( 交换意见 ) afterwards we found it was only an hour and a quarter,
yet it seemed to me that the night must have almost gone, and the dawn must be breaking above us.
My legs were weary( 疲惫的 ) and stiff( 僵硬的 ), for I did not dare to change my position;
yet my nerves( 神经 ) were in a state of enormous tension,
and my hearing was so acute that I could not only hear the gentle breathing of my companions,
but I could distinguish the deeper, heavier in-breath of the bulky( 大块头的 ) Jones from the thin, sighing note of the bank director.
From my position I could look over the crate( 大木箱 ) in the direction of the floor.
Suddenly my eyes saw a light.
At first it was just a bright spot upon the stone floor.
Then it lengthened out until it became a yellow line,
and then, without any warning or sound,
a hole opened and a hand appeared—a white, almost womanly hand, which felt about in the center of the little area of light.
For a minute or more the hand searched around,
and then it was pulled back as suddenly as it appeared,
and all was dark again except for the single bright spot which marked a gap( 裂缝 ) between the stones.
Suddenly, with a loud tearing sound, one of the broad, white stones was turned over,
leaving a large, square hole, through which shone the light of a lantern.
Over the edge there appeared a boyish face, which looked carefully about,
and then, with a hand on each side of the hole, drew itself up until one knee rested upon the edge.
In another instant he stood at the side of the hole and was pulling after him a companion, agile( 敏捷的 ) and small like himself, with a pale face and a head of very red hair.
“It’s all clear,” he whispered. “Have you got the tools and the bags?
Oh, no! Jump, Archie, jump!”
Sherlock Holmes had jumped out and grabbed( 抓住 ) the intruder( 闯入者 ) by the collar.
The other dived down( 窜入 ) the hole,
and I heard the sound of tearing cloth as Jones grabbed( 抓住 ) at his jacket.
The light flashed upon a gun, but Holmes’s whip( 鞭子 ) came down on the man’s wrist, and the gun fell upon the stone floor.
“It’s no use, John Clay,” said Holmes calmly. “You have no chance at all.”
“So I see,” the other answered with the utmost( 极度的 ) coolness.
“I think my friend is safe, though I see you almost caught him.”
“There are three men waiting for him at the door,” said Holmes.
“Oh, indeed! You seem to have done the thing very completely. I must compliment( 称赞 ) you.”
“And I must compliment( 称赞 ) you,” Holmes answered.
“Your red-headed idea was very new and effective.”
“You’ll see your friend again presently( 马上 ),” said Jones.
“He’s quicker at climbing down holes than I am. Just hold out your hands for the handcuffs( 手铐 ).”
“Do not touch me with your filthy( 肮脏的 ) hands,” said our prisoner as the handcuffs( 手铐 ) were fastened around his wrists.
“You may not know that I have royal blood in my veins( 血管 ).
Have the goodness, also, when you speak to me, always to say ‘sir’ and ‘please.’ ”
“All right,” said Jones, laughing quietly to himself.
“Well, would you please, sir, go upstairs, where we can get a cab to carry your Highness( 殿下 ) to the police station?”
“That is better,” said John Clay.
He made a low bow to the three of us and walked quietly off in the custody( 拘押 ) of the detective.
“Really, Mr( 先生 ). Holmes,” said Mr( 先生 ). Merryweather as we followed them from the cellar,
“I do not know how the bank can thank you or repay( 报答 ) you.
You have detected and defeated, in the most complete manner,
one of the most determined attempts at bank robbery that has ever come within my experience.”
“I have wanted to catch Mr( 先生 ). John Clay for some time,” said Holmes.
“I have had some expenses over this matter, which I shall expect the bank to pay back,
but beyond that I have been well rewarded by having had an experience which is in many ways unique,
and by hearing the very remarkable story of the Red-headed League.”
“You see, Watson,” he explained in the early hours of the morning as we sat over a glass of whisky( 威士忌 ) and soda( 苏打 ) in Baker Street( 贝克街，地名 ),
“it was perfectly obvious from the first that the only possible aim of this rather fantastic business of the advertisement of the League,
and the copying of the Encyclopedia( 百科全书 ),
must be to get this not-very-intelligent pawnbroker( 当铺老板 ) out of the way for a number of hours every day.
It was a curious way of managing it, but, really, it would be difficult to suggest a better.
The four pounds a week would be too much to refuse, and what was it to them, who were playing for thousands?
They put in the advertisement,
one of the criminals has the temporary office, the other criminal encourages the man to apply for it,
and together they make sure that he is away for at least four hours every day.
From the time that I heard of the assistant working for half wages,
it was obvious to me that he had some strong reason for taking the job.”
“But how could you guess what the reason was?”
“If there had been women in the house, I should have suspected some kind of love affair.
That, however, was out of the question( 不可能 ).
The man’s business was a small one,
and there was nothing in his house which could account for( 解释 ) such elaborate( 精心的 ) preparations,
or the spending of so much money.
It must, then, be something out of the house.
What could it be?
I thought of the assistant’s love for photography, and the way he would disappear into the cellar.
The cellar!
There was the solution to this complex problem.
Then I found out this mysterious assistant was one of the smartest and most daring criminals in London.
He was doing something in the cellar—something which took many hours a day for months on end( 连续好几个月 ).
What could it be?
I could think of nothing except that he was running a tunnel( 地道 ) to some other building.
I had thought this out when we went to visit the scene of action.
I surprised you by beating upon the pavement( 路面 ) with my stick.
I was finding out whether the cellar stretched( 延伸 ) out in front or behind.
It was not in front.
Then I rang the bell, and, as I hoped, the assistant answered it.
We had never met in person before.
I hardly looked at his face—his knees were what I wished to see.
You must have noticed how worn and dirty they were.
They spoke of those hours of digging.
The only remaining point was what they were digging for.
I walked round the corner, saw the City and Suburban Bank behind our friend’s shop, and felt that I had solved my problem.
When you drove home after the concert I called upon Scotland Yard and upon the chairman of the bank directors, with the result that you have seen.”
“And how could you tell that they would make their attempt tonight?” I asked.
“Well, when they closed their League offices,
that showed that they no longer cared about Mr( 先生 ). Jabez Wilson’s presence—in other words, that they had completed their tunnel( 地道 ).
But they had to use it soon, as it might be discovered, or the gold might be removed.
Saturday would suit them better than any other day, as it would give them two days for their escape.
For all these reasons I expected them to come tonight.”
“You reasoned it out beautifully,” I exclaimed( 惊叫 ) in real admiration,“It is so long a chain, and yet every link rings true.”
“It saved me from boredom,” he answered, yawning.
“Alas( 唉 )! I already feel it closing in upon me.
My life is spent in one long effort to escape from the routine of everyday existence.
These little problems help me to do so.”
“And you in turn help humanity,” said I.
He shrugged( 耸肩 ) his shoulders.
“Well, perhaps, after all, I am of some little use,” he remarked.
“ ‘The man himself is nothing—his work is everything,’ as Gustave Flaubert wrote to George Sand.”

article_info.previous: Dr. Waston赴约，发现警探Peter Jones和银行董事Mr. Merryweather也参与到了这次行动中。四人来到存放着法国黄金的银行地下室，部署好一切，等待着罪犯们自投罗网。
article_info.share_words: Over the edge there appeared a boyish face, which looked carefully about, and then, with a hand on each side of the hole, drew itself up until one knee rested upon the edge.

question.cn: John Clay的同伙成功逃脱了吗？为什么？
question.en: Did the friend of John Clay run away successfully? Why?

options.cn: 是的，他成功逃脱了。因为他根本就没来地下室。
options.en: Yes, he did. Because he didn’t came to the cellar.

options.cn: 不，他没有。因为他被在门口等着的三个警察抓个正着。
options.en: No, he didn’t. Because he was caught by the three policemen waiting for him at the door.

options.cn: 不，他没有。因为他被Dr. Waston开枪打中了。
options.en: No, he didn’t. Because he was shot by Dr. Watson.

analysis: 文中提到：“ ‘I think my friend is safe, though I see you almost caught him.’ ‘There are three men waiting for him at the door.’ said Holmes. ”所以选B。

question.cn: 为什么罪犯鼓励Mr. Wilson去应聘广告上的工作？
question.en: Why did the criminal encourage Mr. Wilson to apply for the job in the advertisement?

options.cn: 因为他想帮助Mr. Wilson挣更多的钱。
options.en: Because he wanted to help Mr. Wilson to earn more money.

options.cn: 因为他想确保Mr. Wilson每天至少有四个小时不在店铺里。
options.en: Because he wanted to make sure that Mr. Wilson was away from the store for at least four hours every day.
Because he wanted to please Mr. Wilson.

analysis: 文中Holmes分析时提到：“They put in the advertisement, one of the criminals has the temporary office, the other criminal encourages the man to apply for it, and together they make sure that he is away for at least four hours every day.”所以选B。

question.cn: Holmes表示，银行如果想感谢他或者付给他报酬，可以怎么做？
question.en: According to Holmes, the bank could thank him or repay him by？

options.cn: 偿还他在这件事情上的花费。
options.en: Paying back his expenses over this matter.

analysis: 文中Holmes说：“I have had some expenses over this matter, which I shall expect the bank to pay back.”所以选C。

question.cn: 为什么罪犯愿意只拿一半工资做助理的工作？
question.en: Why was the criminal willing to work as the assistant at half-wages?

options.cn: 他爱上了在Mr. Wilson当铺做事的那个女孩，想和她一起工作。
options.en: He fell in love with the girl in Mr. Wilson’s house and wanted to work with her.

options.cn: 他想从Mr. Wilson当铺中偷走一些值钱的东西。
options.en: He wanted to steal something valuable from Mr. Wilson’s house.

options.cn: 他想借工作之机挖一条通向其他建筑的地道。
options.en: He wanted to run a tunnel to some other building when working as an assistant.

analysis: 文中Holmes分析时说：“I should have suspected some kind of love affair. That, however, was out of the question. The man’s business was a small one, and there was nothing in his house which could account for such elaborate preparations”所以A、B排除；后面继续分析时说：“I could think of nothing except that he was running a tunnel to some other building.”所以选C。

question.cn: Holmes如何推断出罪犯会在周六夜晚采取行动的？
question.en: How could Holmes tell that the criminals would make their attempt on Saturday night?

options.cn: 因为周六夜晚采取行动可以给他们留出两天的时间用来逃跑。
options.en: Because making attempt on Saturday night would give them two days for their escape.

options.cn: 因为周六是他们的幸运日。
options.en: Because Saturday was their lucky day.

options.cn: 因为福Holmes知道他们总是在周六行动。
options.en: Because Holmes knew that they often make attempt on Saturday.

analysis: 根据原文，Dr. Waston问道：“And how could you tell that they would make their attempt tonight”时，Holmes回答“Saturday would suit them better than any other day, as it would give them two days for their escape.”所以选A。

share_title: 100天读完4本英文书，今天是第51天
